channel.title: Home on eBits's Base Address
channel.description: Recent content in Home on eBits's Base Address

item.title: About
item.description:
Hi, I’m Amiitesh — an open-source enthusiast and passionate Linux and Neovim user. I love working at the intersection of Embedded Systems, Hardware Optimisation, and Low-Level Programming and VLSI.

I contribute to projects across Embedded Systems, Computer Networks, and Systems Programming, and I’m currently diving deeper into Wayland and VLSI design. I enjoy crafting command-line tools and experimenting with C, Zig, C++, Golang and Verilog.

Outside tech, I’m a classical pianist and a diehard fan of Chopin’s repertoire.

item.title: Projects
item.description:
Gort Scanner #

A high-performance port scanner implementation in Go featuring concurrent goroutines and channel-based communication. Efficiently scans network ports with customizable threading and timeout configurations.

Tech Stack: Go • Networking • Concurrency

Source on GitHub

Vat Viewer #

An enhanced file reader utility written in Go that improves upon the traditional 'cat' command. Features Nord-theme syntax highlighting, line numbering, and better code readability for developers.

Tech Stack: Go • Lexers • CLI Tools

item.title: Software that I use and You Can Love
item.description:
Favourite #

Operating System: I use Arch

Text Editor: I use Neovim and Zed

Window Manager: I use River

Terminal: I use Ghostty combined with fish shell.

Most of the softwares I use are made in Zig cause I love it so much :)

Utils #

File Manager: I use Yazi as my main and only file manager.

Web Browser: I use Firefox all the time.

PDF Viewer: I use Zathura as my pdf viewer and firefox sometimes.
